The force of attraction between covalent molecules is?
explanation: Covalent bond involvesthe interatomic linkage that results from the sharing of an electron pair between two atoms. The binding arises from the electrostatic attraction of their nuclei for the same electrons.

text: When concentrated \(H_2SO_4\) is added to NaCI (s), the gas evolved

options.B: forms a white preciptate with AgNO3(aq)
options.C: forms a white precipitate with BaCI2(aq)
options.D: turns moist red litmus paper blue

explanation:
2\(NaCl_{(aq)} + H_2SO_{4(aq)} → Na_2SO_{4(aq)} + 2HCl_{(g)}\)
This gas(hydrochloride gas) turns damp/moist blue litmus paper red while reacting with \(AgNO_{3(aq)}\), a white precipitate of AgCl is produced which is soluble in ammonia solution but insoluble in \(HNO_3\)

text: The collision theory proposes that

options.A: reactants collide more frequently to bring about reduction in the reaction rate
options.B: all collisions of reactants are effective
options.C: reactants must collide with a certain minimum amount of energy to from products
options.D: the fewer the collisions the faster the reaction rate

text: Diamond does not conduct electricity because it?

options.D: is a solid at room temperature

explanation: It does not conduct electricity. Every atom in a diamond is bonded to its neighbours by four strong covalent bonds, leaving no free electrons and no ions .

text: Which of the following set of equations could be used to represent the standard enthalpy of formation of glucose?
The colour of phenolphthalein indicator in dilute HNO is
An aqueous solution of CaCI2 is
Which of the following compounds would dissolved in water to give a solution whose pH is less than 7?
explanation:
Aluminum nitrate (Al(NO3)3) is a salt that dissolves in water to produce hydrogen ions (H\(^+\)), which are acidic:
Al(NO\(_3\))\(_3\) → Al\(^{3+}\) + 3NO\(_3\)\(^-\)
Al\(^{3+}\) + 3H\(^2\)O → Al(OH)\(_3\) + 3H\(^+\)
The released hydrogen ions (H\(^+\)) increase the acidity of the solution, resulting in a pH less than 7.
The other options:
B. Potassium nitrate (KNO\(_3\)) is a neutral salt and does not affect the pH.
C. Nitrous oxide (N\(^2\)O) is a gas and does not dissolve in water to affect pH.
D. Ammonia (NH\(_3\)) is a base and would increase the pH of the solution (make it more alkaline).
So, aluminum nitrate (Al(NO3)3) is the correct answer.

Which of the following compounds would not give a precipitate with ammoniacal AgNO3 solution?
explanation:
Only terminal alkyne(simply, the alkyne in which the triple bonded carbon atoms are at the extreme positions.) reacts with ammonical AgNO3 and gives a white precipitate,
therefore, the correct option is A  (Non-Terminal Alkyne has a triple bond at any place other than the end positions).

Aluminium is a good roofing material because it

options.A: is strong and does not conduct heat and electricity
options.C: forms an oxide film over its surface which prevents corrosion
options.D: is flexible and can conduct heat

explanation: The thin coat of aluminum oxide formed prevents further attack of the metal by atmospheric oxygen and water.
